tool_description: The Kaiko reference API is an open source solution that maps all assets and instruments on all exchanges, accessible through the Market API. More info: https://docs.kaiko.com/#reference-data-api
name: Kaiko - Digital Assets Reference Data
title: Kaiko - Digital Assets Reference Data

api_list.name: Exchanges
api_list.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of supported exchanges.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kaiko-kaiko-digital-assets-reference-data-v1.p.rapidapi.com/v1/exchanges"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kaiko-kaiko-digital-assets-reference-data-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Instruments
api_list.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of supported instruments. There are three possible cases regarding the trading period: • Trading has started and new trading activity is still being consumed (start time fields will be set, but end time fields will be null), • Trading has been recorded but no recent activity has been seen (both start and end time fields are set), • No trading has been registered yet (both start and end time fields are null)

        }
